title.narrative: LOCAL GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: By 2025, local government authorities are better able to develop, finance, coordinate, implement and monitor evidence-based multisectoral plans to improve children's wellbeing., which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, fewer Somali children live in poverty (income-and multi-dimensional) and more have access to adequate social services to enable them to reach their full potential.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, local government authorities are better able to develop, finance, coordinate, implement and monitor evidence-basedmultisectoral plans to improve children?s wellbeing.

description.narrative: The UN Joint Programme on Local Governance and Decentralized Service Delivery (JPLG) has increased footprints in the new Federal Member States and the Service Delivery Model (SDM) has further received political, institutional and financial commitments in Somaliland, Puntland and the new FMS. This is allowing a further expansion of local governments support to basic social services. This geographical expansion allows activities like ToT on “Inclusive local governance – Mainstreaming Child rights and Children participation in Local Governance” to influence large officials and newly elected district councilors. In November “Berbera” City in Somaliland won the “Global Child Friendly City Aspire Award”. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/01/2022
